alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 26 at 7:35PM CDT until August 28 at 11:48AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River Near Holden affecting Livingston Parish. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River Near Montpelier affecting St. Helena Parish. For the Tickfaw River...including Liverpool, Holden, Killian, Montpelier...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tickfaw River Near Holden. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 17.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 01/08/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
